session.content: I've started avoiding screens before bedtime to improve my sleep quality.
That's a great idea! Reducing screen time before bed can help you fall asleep faster and improve the quality of your sleep.
Yeah, I read that the blue light from screens can interfere with melatonin production.
Exactly! Melatonin is the hormone that regulates your sleep-wake cycle. Less screen time means better melatonin production.
Do you have any other tips for better sleep?
Sure! Try to maintain a consistent sleep schedule, create a relaxing bedtime routine, and make your sleep environment comfortable and dark.

topics.description: The user's goal to improve sleep quality and their habits related to sleep.
